subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: The Mughal Empire: Islam in India
description: A quick win: understand The Mughal Empire: Islam in India.

hook.text: A Muslim dynasty built the Taj Mahal, ruled millions of Hindus, and created one of history's richest civilizations.

buildup.text: The Mughals ruled India from 1526 to 1857. Babur founded the dynasty; Akbar made it great through tolerance.

discovery.text: Emperor Akbar held interfaith dialogues and abolished the tax on non-Muslims. He tried to unite Hindu and Muslim.

twist.text: Aurangzeb reversed Akbar's tolerance, reimposing religious taxes. The empire declined as unity fractured.

climax.text: The Mughal experience shows that tolerance builds empires and intolerance destroys them. The pattern repeats.

punchline.text: Akbar built with tolerance. Aurangzeb broke it with force. Empires choose.

quiz.question: How did Emperor Akbar approach religious diversity?
options: He banned all religions except Islam
He promoted interfaith dialogue and tolerance
